ISceneGraph

Our main interface for manipulating a scene graph

Functions
ClearSelected
virtual void ClearSelected() = 0

Deselects all the currently selected objects.

SelectObject
virtual void SelectObject(
ISceneElem* pSceneElem
) = 0

Selects the specified scene element.

Parameters
pSceneElem
ISceneElem*

scene element to select

DeselectObject
virtual void DeselectObject(
ISceneElem* pSceneElem
) = 0

Deselects the specified scene element.

Parameters
pSceneElem
ISceneElem*

scene element to select

GetShowProxyObjects
virtual bool GetShowProxyObjects() = 0

Returns whether proxy objects (for things such as lights) are rendered in the scene.

Returns

True if proxy objects are displayed. False otherwise.

SetShowProxyObjects
virtual void SetShowProxyObjects(
bool show
) = 0

Enables or disables rendering of proxy objects

Parameters
show
bool

if true proxy objects are displayed. if false they aren't rendered.

PathTrace
virtual void PathTrace(
IRenderer* pRenderer,
PathTraceCtx* pCtx,
IImage* pDest
) = 0

Computes view of the scene using path tracing

Parameters
pRenderer
IRenderer*

renderer

pCtx
PathTraceCtx*

path context

pDest
IImage*

Image to render results to

Merge
virtual void Merge(
ISceneGraph* pGraph
) = 0

Merges a scene graph with another scene graph

Lock
virtual void Lock() = 0

Locks a scene graph so it can be updated

Unlock
virtual void Unlock() = 0

Unlocks a scene graph allowing the renderer to use it

GetCameras
virtual CRefObj<ISceneCameraCollectionElem> GetCameras() = 0

Returns list of available cameras
